fields.description:
The treemap that appears on the clover dashboard also includes code from the test model.
Test code should not be included in the treemap.
fields.summary: TreeMap on Dashboard includes Test Code. treemap.html does not.
Always set logging level if -Dclover.logging.level={verbose|debug} is set

fields.description:
Currently when a line in the Test Runs becomes visible it starts computation of contribution coverage, using invokeLater()
The queue is not bound and not cancellable, as the result if you scroll the view for Jira CPU will be hogged for a long time.
UI becomes less responsive, although it does not block completely.

Solution:
- create a manageable queue to be calculated off the UI thread
- make the process cancellable.
fields.summary: Updating test coverage UI can hog UI for very long time

fields.description: see: https://developer.atlassian.com/jira/browse/CLMVN-129
fields.summary: new option 'copyExcludedFiles' in maven-clover2-plugin

fields.description:
A customer has some test classes defined that do not have an JUnit test methods. They want to exclude these from the coverage reports. Something like the following works mostly, but not if there is a test class that has methods, but also contains a nested test class that doesn't.

{code:xml}<target name="clover.html">
        <clover-report>
        <current outfile="clover_html" title="Test">
        <format type="html" />
        <fileset dir="src/test/java" id="testfiles">
                <or>
                        <contains text="public void test" />
                        <contains text="@Test" />
                </or>
        </fileset>
        <fileset dir="src/main/java" />
        </current>
        </clover-report>
</target>
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to exclude test classes that don't have any methods defined

fields.description:
The embedded crowd build was failing with clover turned on.

The problem was that when 'clean verify' was run before the clover goals, the clover.jar was no longer on the test time classpath.
This caused two tests to fail in the embedded-crowd-ofbiz module.

Adding a clover dependency with scope 'provided' seems to have fixed this.
fields.summary: Fix embedded crowd build to work with maven+clover plugin

fields.description:
Some Clover users have a separate project in eclipse for their tests.
Clover currently doesn't merge coverage data across projects in eclipse - nor will it report on per-test coverage for such projects.
fields.summary: Merge coverage data across an eclipse workspace

Create installer

fields.description:
Some excellent user feedback from Sam and Justin internally:

Clover Test Optimization in IDEA (eclipse too!) needs to optionally be able to run on every Make (but not on Full Builds?) event.

This means that there is no need for a user to jump through the hoops of assigning a new shortcut key to the "Run Optimized" action.

What hoops?
* clone the existing Keymap
* think of, and find a free shortcut combination
* configure the Default test run configuration to "Make" and not "show this dialog" before each invocation.

The first time a user chooses to "Run Optimized" - the plugin could ask them if they wish to "Run Optimized" after every time they Make.
This should also be a configuration option in the "Test Optimization" section.
fields.summary: New option to "Run Optimized Tests" on every Make (CMD-F9)

fields.description:
Provide a means for a user to turn clover coverage data collection on/off at runtime. 
From [the forums|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=37195&tstart=0]:

{quote}
 Can I clear the coverage results for a session without disabling the CC runtime engine? For example, here's a use case:
a) Start my app while integrated with the CC runtime, but keep the runtime disabled. Expect very low overhead (eg, in the instrumented code, calls to the Clover CC runtime could first check the boolean value of some env var before making the call - don't make the call if CC is currently set to false/disabled).
b) Begin manual GUI testing. Come to the starting point of where you want to start collecting CC data.
c) Programmatically enable CC engine to start collecting data (flag is now true, and CC runtime starts receiving calls).
d) Continue testing the app until the point where you no longer wish to receive CC data.
e) Programmatically disable CC engine so that no more coverage data is received (until the next time that I enable it).
I would like to use YourKit and Clover together to profile a specific use case (functional tests) out of a large collection of tests, and to have the YourKit and Clover results correlate with each other for that time period.
{quote}
fields.summary: Allow users to enable/disable coverage collection at runtime.
Make it obvious when an old version of clover.jar is in the classpath

fields.description:
When a Job has no targets defined, the clover hudson plugin fails.

The clover.fullclean target should only get called if there are no other targets, otherwise the default will not be invoked by Ant.
Also - clover.fullclean should be an option for the plugin.
fields.summary: List out of bounds in Hudson clover plugin

fields.description:
If a unit test expects a method name in the stack to exist at a certain location, the test will fail if instrumented by Clover due to the synthetic test method.

e.g. see: http://code.google.com/p/mockito/source/browse/trunk/test/org/mockitoutil/ExtraMatchers.java
fields.summary: Preserve stack names in synthetic test method names.

fields.description: As suggested on the Hudson Dev mailing list, it would be great to have Clover support in the Hudson Violations plugin: http://wiki.hudson-ci.org/display/HUDSON/Violations .
fields.summary: Add Clover to the Hudson Violations Plugin

fields.description:
We run clover simply by running "ant clover.all".  The only settings we have in our build.xml are these lines:

    <property name="clover.jar" value="${lib.dir}/clover/clover-2.6.0.jar"/>
    <property name="clover.dest" value="${project.dir}/build/clover-report"/>
    <taskdef resource="cloverlib.xml" classpath="${clover.jar}"/>
    <clover-env/>

With clover-2.4.0 and 2.5.0 this worked pretty well.  But now I replaced the clover JAR file with the 2.6.0 version, and instrumentation fails.  Here's the output:

Buildfile: build.xml
[clover-env] Loading clover.xml: jar:file:/lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/lib/clover/clover-2.6.0.jar!/clover.xml

clover.clean:
[clover-clean] Clover Version 2.6.0, built on September 09 2009 (build-771)
[clover-clean] Loaded from: /lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/lib/clover/clover-2.6.0.jar
[clover-clean] Clover: Open Source License registered to JGraLab.

with.clover:
[clover-setup] Clover Version 2.6.0, built on September 09 2009 (build-771)
[clover-setup] Loaded from: /lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/lib/clover/clover-2.6.0.jar
[clover-setup] Clover: Open Source License registered to JGraLab.
[clover-setup] Clover is enabled with initstring '/lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/.clover/clover2_6_0.db'

clover.all:
[clover-env] Loading clover.xml: jar:file:/lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/lib/clover/clover-2.6.0.jar!/clover.xml

cleanall:

cleanall:
     [echo] ../common/build.xml clean all - deleting all generated files
   [delete] Deleting directory /lab/gupro/ist/ukoisthome/jgralab/build
     [echo] clean all finished

jgralab:

compile:
     [echo] ../common/build.xml compile - compiling sources

Hundreds of similar errors complaining about the missing getNullRecorder() method follow for all classes that should be instrumented.

I ensured that there's only the new clover-2.6.0.jar in the CLASSPATH, and I also deleted the myProject/.clover/ directory and made clean, so that there are no old class files around.
fields.summary: [SOLVED] After upgrade 2.5.0 -> 2.6.0: "ant clover.all" fails with "cannot find symbol, 'symbol: method getNullRecorder()', 'location: class com_cenqua_clover.Clover'"

fields.description:
See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CLV-5267

Currently there is only a small gray overlay on the folder that is easy to overlook.

There should be an explicit warning message when the user selects a disabled folder as test folder.
It should still be possible to select a disabled folder - the user may have disabled it temporarily.
fields.summary: Add an eye-catching warning when the user selects a test folder which is disabled from instrumentation
Add Groovy support to Clover

fields.description: Means we're less likely to make a release which generates instrumented code that doesn't compile.
fields.summary: Make explicit the link between runtime methods and their use in instrumented code

fields.description:
globalSliceEnd(String,String,int) no longer exists on CoverageRecorder

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CLV-5266
fields.summary: recordTestResults="false" causes compile errors
When outputting Clovered class files, allow users to either recreate output dirs or use a single dir
Update acknowledgements in CEP / CIJ
Update CEP icon shown in about box

fields.description: In prepration for a UI plugin.
fields.summary: Move CEP UI classes into com.cenqua.clover.eclipse.ui

fields.description:
Steps taken:
1. Installed the plugin, added Clover to two projects: one containing a test, another one I wanted to measure the coverage for.
2. I've run a single JUnit test class with "Run With Clover | As JUnit"
3. The test ran fine,  TestRunExplorer, CoverageExplorer, TestContributions were populated correctly.
4. But the Eclipse process in OS seemed to take more and more GDI objects (as reported by taskmgr.exe). This led to first Eclipse being not responsive, then even all the other applications having problems to render them correctly. The GDI objects number kept on growing until it reached 10000, which was enough for my computer.

Note that the GDI objects number keeps on rising without a single click in Eclipse after selecting the "CoverageExplorer" view (about new 8-12 GDI objects each second). Without EclipseForClover no such a problem is observed when running tests.
Reverting the changes in ".classpath" and ".project" and restarting Eclipse restores the proper behaviour.
fields.summary: GDI objects leak
Don't reload all per-test data when some has been added
site.xml and feature.xml don't reference Eclipse 3.5 RAD 7.5 support
Ensure includes / excludes are operated on the live model to avoid a full rebuild
Test Run Explore fails if a test method's source has been removed

fields.description: Byte code instrumentation in the style of Emma is a necessary feature before we can integrate clover into our development suite.  Opening this as a feature request.

fields.summary: "Failed to lazily load instrumentation session" when loading old format database is confusing

fields.description: An umbrella issue for more advanced Clover Bamboo integration.
fields.summary: Improve Clover Bamboo plugin - Phase #2

fields.description:
When a user has disabled Clover for the entire project, yet has a module that has Clover enabled, then Clover will still be run on that Module.

!http://img.skitch.com/20090901-x6tp8k4d1wqxwqju7uh3f34px7.jpg!
fields.summary: If a module has Clover enabled, the Global 'Disable Clover' setting is ignored.

fields.description:
Even though the Clover is disabled, (via the About panel)
!http://img.skitch.com/20090901-dj2d3ucc37spix55htf84gryem.jpg!

I can still see the Module clover icons

!http://img.skitch.com/20090901-mquqphcqfmx8epbepdgkdun5kx.jpg!

And the Clover plugin still appears to validate the configuration before tests get run, causing a lengthy pause. see also: CLOV-706.
!http://img.skitch.com/20090901-j287812jihrq229x7bdt5xsce8.jpg!

Is it possible for the Clover plugin to update the Model when a configuration is modified only, and not on the fly as tests get run?

At the very least, if not enabled - the Clover plugin should not be invoked, or do _no heavy lifting_ when a user wants to run their tests or compile their code.
It seems that at the moment just by having the Clover plugin installed in IntelliJ will cause pauses in the UI for projects with many modules.
fields.summary: Clover plugin still active when 'disabled'.

fields.description:
The bamboo project has many many modules.

When Clover is enabled on but a single one module - and a test in that module is run, there is a extremely long pause on the UI thread (the entire UI freezes).


This is reproducible by using clover on a single module in the Bamboo project.

As an aside - for projects with many many modules, it would make more sense to have a global Clover config screen to allow including/excluding of modules.
fields.summary: IDEA: Very long pause when Clover is enabled and a test is run - on projects with many modules

fields.description:
The Coverage Explorer should automatically hide any packages or classes that have 0 elements in them.

The Coverage Explorer becomes otherwise too noisy when a project contains many Interfaces.
fields.summary: Coverage Explorer should not  display project packages/classes with Zero elements
Move historical movers and added files to top of historical report.
